page.title: 07 A Typical Farm
page.content: Close to Yardley Hastings is a farm which is owned by Mr and Mrs Keggin. The farm has 160 sheep with their lambs a donkey,six geese and goslings, and some baby pheasants.The hen hut contained three chickens,six hens, two cockerels and a rooster.There are 540 acres of land on the farm most of which is under the plough.There are 37 fields altogether containing crops such as wheat and barley.The farm house farm was built in 1840. The farmer usually wakes at 7:00 in the morning,and he works up to 7,12 or 16 hours a day depending on the time of year.There is a combined-harvester and a tractor as well as other machinery. for ploughing and harvesting.With todays mechanisation most of the work can be done by just 2 men.
